Comments: Requires valid legal reasoning to share data with law enforcement

genetic data is not publicly available, but records such as birth, marriage, death, burial, census, military, immigration, yearbooks are; family sites and certain settings can allow for publicly accessible genetic data; Riverside County Regional Cold Case uploaded data here to search
opt-in option for scientific researcher that 81% of users do
sell access to law enforcement, however users can opt out; have history of violating Terms of Service

sell access to law enforcement and have history of violating Terms of Service, since law enforcement used this database to find Golden State Killer, they have created an opt-in option for sharing data with law enforcement; many companies give data to GEDmatch
anonymous data is shared with third parties, and opt-in option to share data with researchers, do not sell data to law enforcement unless feel they are legally compelled
